links.*: The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age
The Lord of the Rings Online
The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood

wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|November}}
Events that occurred on 2 November.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1918]]''' – [[Inklings|Inkling]] [[Roger Lancelyn Green]] is born.
* '''[[1956]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 193]].
* '''[[1958]]''' - [[Taum Santoski]], Tolkien linguist, is born.
* '''[[1959]]''' - Actor [[Peter Mullan]] is born.
* '''[[1962]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 241a]].
* '''[[1983]]''' - Actor [[Michael Spice]] dies.
* '''[[1986]]''' - Voice actor [[Paul Frees]] dies.
* '''[[1990]]''' - [[Donald A. Wollheim]] dies.
* '''[[2002]]''' - The symposium "J.R.R. Tolkien: The Man Behind The Lord of the Rings" is held at the [http://acmrs.org/ Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies]. [[Tom Shippey]], [[Randel Helms]] and Ron Newcomer speak.
* '''[[2004]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]'' is released in North America.
* '''[[2010]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online|The Lord of the Rings Online:]] [[The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood#Volume III: Allies of the King|Volume III: Allies of the King]]'', "Ride of the Grey Company" is released in Europe.
* '''[[2010]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' goes free-to-play for the general public in Europe.
* '''[[2011]]''' - ''[[The Loss and the Silence|The Loss and the Silence: Aspects of Modernism in the Works of C.S. Lewis, J.R.R. Tolkien & Charles Williams]]'' is published.

==In Arda==
* {{FA|495}}:
** [[Tuor]], guided by [[Voronwë]], travels to [[Gondolin]] in order to deliver [[Ulmo]]'s message to [[Turgon]].
* {{TA|3018}}:
** {{Cal Preparation-Company}}
* {{TA|3019}}:
** The [[Travellers]] come to [[Bywater]] and [[Horn-call of Buckland|rouse]] the [[Hobbits|Shire-folk]].
*The above event was commemorated in [[Buckland]] by sounding the [[Horn of the Mark]] and other festivities.
<noinclude>[[Category:Dates|307]][[de:2. November]][[fi:2. marraskuuta]]</noinclude>
